headline: Creamy Shrimp Scampi with Half-and-Half
description: Dinner doesn't have to take forever--prove it with this fast and delicious creamy shrimp scampi recipe made with half and half.
name: Creamy Shrimp Scampi with Half-and-Half
recipeIngredient: 1 pound jumbo shrimp, peeled and deveined
2 teaspoons lemon juice, or to taste
2 tablespoons chopped fresh parsley, or to taste

recipeInstructions.text: Bring a large pot of lightly salted water to a boil. Cook linguine at a boil until tender yet firm to the bite, about 8 minutes.

While pasta cooks, melt 2 tablespoons butter in a skillet over medium heat. Add garlic and cook until fragrant and lightly browned, about 1 minute. Add shrimp and cook until tails start curling in, about 2 minutes per side. Add remaining butter, Pinot Grigio, lemon juice, half-and-half, and Parmesan cheese. Stir to incorporate.
Drain linguine and divide noodles between 2 bowls. Serve shrimp mixture on top and garnish with parsley.

review.reviewBody: I love this recipe! Very easy to make and quick !

Great, easy recipe! Others had commented on there not being enough sauce, so I increased the half-n-half to 2/3 cup, used some olive oil with the 2 tbsp. butter to sauté and increased the wine to a little over 1/4 cup. Increased the Parmesan also, a few red pepper flakes too. Turned out perfect! Served with freshly grated pepper. Thank you so much for such a versatile recipe!

I don’t eat shrimp, but my husband loves it, so I make this for him often. I use frozen jumbo shrimp, thawed, and add it to the butter, lemon, garlic, wine sauté, being careful not to overcook the already cooked shrimp. Then I add the 1/2 & 1/2, cheese, and plenty of cracked black pepper and let it heat through. Husband loves this recipe. Thanks so much!
I added more lemon but I like the citrus taste
Added crushed red pepper flakes and cut shrimp in half length wise. Very good
Great recipe
Wonderful sauce! I used it over lobster ravioli instead of noodles and the meal was a hit. Thanks so much for sharing the recipe - we'll use it regularly.
I made this tonight but made some subs. I added regular milk with a little bit of cream cheese. Use angel hair pasta and added italian cheese mix, spinach and mushrooms! It was delish!

OMG!!! This recipe was so simple and Delicious!!! I will No longer order Shrimp Scampi from Olive Garden or Red Lobster!!! So much cheaper than eating out, I had way more shrimp (I used Jumbo shrimp) plus I had leftovers. Thank You for posting this recipe.

This pasta was great and easy to make! I agree with the other reviewers- could definitely use more garlic, lemon, and the like. It was just a tad on the bland side, but would be exceptional with just a bit more of all the flavors.
It was great, I also use regular milk with the half and half. Add lobster claws. Onions and green bell peppers. I thank you so much!
This recipe is great - I made it as listed.. yet did double the sauce ingredients (anticipating the pasta absorbing it) and all enjoyed it! Fresh parmesan cheese really helped balance the flavors!
Easy and delicious will definitely make again!

Loved this! Definitely make it again. Changed a few things - just trying to be a tiny bit healthier. For half and half used fat free version, plus added a bunch more fresh garlic and fresh ground better. Family loved it!

I really enjoyed this dish! The sauce was on the thin side, but the pasta soaked it up and was really good. I did add Dijon mustard that was in another scampi recipe I looked at. Thought it added a little extra tang. Will definitely make this one again. Very easy to throw together.
How do you have shrimp scampi without garlic? it's a bland mess. add the garlic if you want to live.
i changed out the Pinot for chicken stock because we dont use alcohol to cook and it was wonderful.
Great recipe. I doubled the garlic and it was awesome!
My entire family of 6 loves this, including my step-daughter who eats about a total of 3 different things. Easy, quick and a nice addition to our meal rotation.
Delicious. Only change I made was to add pesto
Pretty good. Would definitely make it again.
I used heavy cream instead of half and half. It was really good. I think this would also be good with chicken

This recipe was very good but I found that I needed to double the recipe if serving more than two people. I also would recommend putting in the pre-cooked shrimp last as mine were over cooked. It was very tasty and will make again.

Made it pretty much as the recipe called for..... OK, OK, so we like more garlic in things! But we thought this was pretty good and we did enjoy it very much. However, we both decided that we prefer regular Shrimp Scampi (emphasis on the lemon/wine/butter marriage w/o the parm) to this. Will stick with the tried and true.
No changes

Perfect! I used Angel Hair pasta because that’s what I had, and added some chopped up artichoke hearts. I’ve made variations of this recipe before but never added the half and half. I think it made the dish!
I will definitely make again
This is quick meal, I liked the concept of it, but , I would use heavy cream next time and add pepper.
Very simple, very nice! One of the best pasta dishes! My wife loved it.

This is wonderful! I made it for me and my husband, but it would make a great entree for guests too. So easy - I used pre-cooked shrimp and only had the grated parmesan in a can, but it was still delicious. Definitely a keeper.
Love, love, love! So easy to make. A little rich, but, yeah.... : )
Absolutely wonderful! We didnt have enough pasta for 4 people, so I also made some Spanish rice to go with it. My whole family loved it.
Recipe was awesome! Added some freshly grated mozzarella into the sauce and some red pepper flakes. Perfection.

This is so good and so easy! I did liberally sprinkle the shrimp with Old Bay seasoning and let set for 1/2 hr. before cooking. Also added more garlic. Can’t thank you enough for posting this great recipe! It’s a keeper.
Added more garlic , very yummy!
This was creamy and delicious! I used heavy cream instead of half and half and a pinch of oregano instead of parsley which I did not have.
I will definitely make this again. Easy and delicious!
Outstanding!!!
Easy peasy. Quick and delicious and filling.

Love this recipe. I have been making a similar dish for awhile and decided to try this one because I thought the addition of the half and half would be a good fit. I was right. I have to say that shrimp without garlic just is a letdown. I love garlic so I used a whole garlic and I marinated the shrimp in garlic powder as well. Added about a tablespoon of red pepper flakes as well as 2 tablespoons of paprika. I also used olive oil along with the butter and used my homemade blueberry wine because it was all I had on hand. This one is my new go to. Thanks for the great recipe.
I make this dish often, usually when I'm runny late and need something quick for dinner. I always have pasta in the pantry and shrimp in the freezer. This dish is a snap to make.
